Player History
Drafted in 5th round, 117th overall pick, by Northeastern in 1963...
Injured on 7/16/1963 with a Strained Back Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 5/17/1968 with a Hyper Extended Elbow, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 4/25/1969 with a Sore Back, out for one week...
Injured on 5/7/1969 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Injured on 8/31/1969 with a Pulled Tricep Muscle, out for 5 weeks...
Injured on 7/18/1970 with a Tight Shoulder, out for one week...
Injured on 7/26/1970 with a Strained Elbow Ligament, out for 5-6 weeks...
Earned first career win on 4/13/1971...
Had first career hit (triple) on 7/31/1971, off Elly Mae Clampett (NJ)...
Injured on 4/15/1973 with a Strained Tricep Muscle, out for 6 weeks...
Hit first career homerun on 10/4/1973, off Tanner Fye (CBC)...
Traded from Northeastern to Syracuse on 7/7/1974 (Going to SYR: P J. Fleites, C T. Linnane. Going to NE: C C. Herrero, P D. Pardo, LF D. Castillo)...
Injured on 8/3/1974 with a Ruptured Elbow Ligament, out for 6 weeks...
Injured on 5/25/1975 with a Ruptured Tricep Tendon, out for 7 weeks...
Injured on 6/1/1976 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Injured on 5/1/1977 with a Pulled Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/16/1979, winning 2 games with a 0.54 ERA...
Was selected to the 1979 Allstar game...
Signed as a free agent by Capital City on 2/8/1982 to a 2-year deal worth $471,500 per year...
